parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model, Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the skin response measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the skin response measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Skin Response CRF using the date (SRDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if a skin response test as performed. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a skin response test was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Skin Response Test Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SRSTAT. If SRPERF = "N", the value of SRSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SRPERF = "Y", SRSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SRCAT and SRSCAT, SRTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD would be populated as SRALL and an appropriate test name SRTEST provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRPERF
fields.questionText: Was a skin response test performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why the test or examination was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (or example, broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When SRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable SRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Skin Response Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the test was not done?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRGRPID

fields.completionInstructions: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain.
fields.implementationNotes: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on this horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Skin Response Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SRGRPID
fields.questionText: What is the [SRTEST] group identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the skin response category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Skin Response Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SRCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the skin response?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SROBJ

self.title: Skin Response Object of the Observation

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Intervention administered.
fields.definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by SRTEST.
fields.implementationNotes: The SROBJ may be collected, pre-printed on the CRF, or referenced from another CRF where the intervention was recorded. For example, TB Skin Test, allergy testing, study drug injection.
fields.label: Skin Response Object of the Observation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SROBJ
fields.questionText: What intervention was administered to evaluate the skin response?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRRFTDAT

self.title: Skin Response Date of Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of the [intervention] administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the reference time point represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. If the date of administration is collected on a separate CRF (e.g., VISDAT), then it should not be collected on the Skin Response CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Date of Reference Time Point
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC using the ISO 8601 format. SDTMIG Time point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPT, SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRRFTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the [intervention] was administered?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRRFTTIM

self.title: Skin Response Time of Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of the [intervention] administration using this format (hh:mm).
fields.definition: The time of the reference time point represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis of the skin response (e.g., multiple [intervention] administrations). The time of measurement can be determined from a collected time of the visit (VISTIM) and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Skin Response Time of Reference Time Point
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC using the ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRRFTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time the [intervention] was administered?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the anatomical location of the reaction site.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the reaction site.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed on the CRF, or referenced from another CRF (e.g. where the intervention was recorded) when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. If the SRLOC is collected on a separate CRF, then it should not be collected on the Skin Response CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Skin Response Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location where the tests were performed.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRTPT

self.title: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for skin response, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) and SRRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point for skin response measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of skin response measurement(s) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT) and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Date of Skin Response Observation
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC using the ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the skin response was assessed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of skin response measurements represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: A single time can be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_SRTIM. Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Skin Response Time of Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC using the ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the reaction site where the test was performed.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. If the SRDIR is collected or referenced on a separate CRF, then it should not be collected on the Skin Response CRF. If SRDIR needs to be collected for each test on the horizontal record the CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_ SRDIR can be used.
fields.label: Skin Response Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SREVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SREVAL
fields.questionText: Who provided the skin response measurement information?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SREVALID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
fields.definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in SREVAL.
fields.implementationNotes: If EVALID needs to be collected for each test on the horizontal record the CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_ EVALID can be used.
fields.label: Skin Response Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SREVALID
fields.questionText: What was the identifier of the evaluator providing the skin response measurement information?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name
Results or Findings in Original Units
Skin Response Test or Examination Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the skin response test results.
fields.definition: Result of the [SRTEST] as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., FLARESZ ) or [TESTCD]_SRORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the SR test code (e.g., FLARESZ_SRORRES).
fields.label: Skin Response Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". In addition to the SDTMIG variable SRORRES, create the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of SRTEST from SRTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the SRTEST.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the unit of measure associated with the test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.
fields.label: Skin Response Result Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SRORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRNRIND

fields.completionInstructions: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
fields.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
fields.implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by SRORNRLO and SRORNRHI or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
fields.label: Skin Response Reference Range Indicator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRNRIND
fields.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: If this level of information is needed, it may be added to the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPSR dataset as the value of SUPPSR.QVAL where SUPPSR.QNAM = "SRCLSIG" and SUPPSR.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRCLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the result clinically significant?
